thread.title: Main Street S.F. businesses can get microloans through Kiva
thread.title_full: Main Street S.F. businesses can get microloans through Kiva - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Carolyn Said
title: Main Street S.F. businesses can get microloans through Kiva
text:
Photo: Connor Radnovich, The Chronicle Phil Weiner, founder of Urbnearth, (center) and Jaimee Erickson explain Urbnearth at an event sponsored by Kiva at San Francisco City Hall in San Francisco, California, on Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. Phil Weiner, founder of Urbnearth, (center) and Jaimee Erickson...
Mark Quinn has lent money to about 50 small Bay Area companies, helping buy a dough roller for a Pinole bakery and a sewing machine for a Mexican immigrant’s embroidery business, for instance. But the loans aren’t through his day job as San Francisco district director for the Small Business Administration. The enterprises and their loan sizes are too small for that agency or for bank financing, and the borrowers may not have qualified anyway. Phil Weiner, founder of Urbnearth, (center) and Jaimee Erickson explain Urbnearth at an event sponsored by Kiva at San Francisco City Hall in San Francisco, California, on Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015. Phil Weiner, founder of Urbnearth, (center) and Jaimee Erickson...
Mark Quinn has lent money to about 50 small Bay Area companies, helping buy a dough roller for a Pinole bakery and a sewing machine for a Mexican immigrant’s embroidery business, for instance. But the loans aren’t through his day job as San Francisco district director for the Small Business Administration. The enterprises and their loan sizes are too small for that agency or for bank financing, and the borrowers may not have qualified anyway.
